title: const adt params and const mut refs ICE

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
I know the code below is wrong, but I expect a normal compiler error rather than an ICE. ### Code ```Rust #![feature(const_mut_refs)] #![feature(adt_const_params)] struct T; impl T { const fn set_false(&self) { unsafe { *(B as *const bool as *mut bool) = false; } } } const _: () = { let x = T::<{&true}>; x.set_false(); }; fn main() { } ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.65.0-nightly (f03ce3096 2022-08-08) ``` ### Error output ``` error: internal compiler error: compiler/rustc_middle/src/ty/consts/int.rs:220:13: expected int of size 8, but got size 1 ```
Backtrace

``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box', /rustc/f03ce30962cf1b2a5158667eabae8bf6e8d1cb03/compiler/rustc_errors/src/lib.rs:1392:9 stack backtrace: 0: 0x7f3fe7e5ec60 - std::backtrace_rs::backtrace::libunwind::trace::he73bf82d737d304d at /rustc/f03ce30962cf1b2a5158667eabae8bf6e8d1cb03/library/std/src/../../backtrace/src/backtrace/mod.rs:66:5 1: 0x7f3fe7e5ec60 -
